units.title: hPSC passaging and seeding
units.text:
7. In a new 1.7-ml Eppendorf tube, prepare 1 ml of mTeSR Plus for one well of a 12-well plate. Seed the cells at a 1:12 ratio to the newly prepared mTeSR.
8. Aspirate the Matrigel-coating medium from the well and add your passaged cells in mTeSR Plus to the well. Return to the incubator.
9. Days 2–5. Starting on day 2 (where day 0 is the day of cell seeding in Step 8), change the medium every other day with fresh mTeSR Plus medium (no medium change is needed on day 1). Healthy hPSCs will reach a confluency of 80–90% 4–5 d after passage.
units.rationale: Describes the routine passaging and seeding of hPSCs before differentiation.

units.title: Y27632 pretreatment of hPSCs
units.text: 10. Pretreat hPSCs with 1 ml of mTeSR Plus medium supplemented with 10 µM Y27632 for 1 h. Then, aspirate the medium and wash the cells with 1 ml of PBS.
units.rationale: Provides a critical step to improve hPSC survival during single‑cell passaging.

units.title: Accumax-mediated hPSC dissociation
units.text:
11. Aspirate 1 ml of PBS and add 0.5 ml of Accumax solution (pre-warmed to 37 °C) and put the plate in an incubator for 12–18 min. Every 3–4 min, take the plate out of the incubator and tap gently to facilitate hPSC dissociation. The dissociation is considered complete when most of the hPSCs are detached from the plate, with most of the floating hPSCs as either single cells or small clusters with fewer than five cells.
12. After Accumax dissociation, add 0.5 ml of mTeSR Plus medium supplemented with 10 µM Y27632 to neutralize the digestion reaction. Now, the total volume of cell solution is ~1 ml.
13. Pipette up and down gently 10 times to break down the cell clusters into a single‑cell solution.
units.rationale: Details the enzymatic dissociation and neutralization needed to obtain a single‑cell suspension.

units.title: Phase I medium addition for iNPC differentiation
units.text: 20. Day 0. Before initiating the differentiation, first aspirate the culture medium and wash with 1 ml of PBS, before adding 1 ml of the phase I medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Initiates the first stage of hPSC‑to‑iNPC differentiation with Phase I medium.

units.title: Phase II medium addition for iNPC differentiation
units.text: 22. On day 4, aspirate the phase I medium and add 1.2 ml of phase II medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Transitions cells from primitive streak to posterior intermediate mesoderm.

units.title: Phase III medium addition for iNPC differentiation
units.text: 24. On day 7, aspirate the phase II medium and add 1.2 ml of phase III medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Advances differentiation toward nephron progenitor cells.

units.title: iNPC aggregation and transfer to Transwell
units.text:
55. Seed ~25,000–30,000 iNPCs into one well of a 96-well U‑bottom low‑attachment plate in 100 µl of hNPSR‑v2 medium and then centrifuge the plate at 300g for 5 min.
56. After centrifugation, place the plate in the incubator to allow the cells to aggregate overnight.
57. Day 0. The iNPC aggregates are transferred to the membrane of a Transwell for air–liquid interface culture. First, in a six-well Transwell plate, add 1 ml of phase I medium (Table 7) to the bottom chamber of each well.
58. To transfer the aggregates without compromising their spherical structure, cut the tip of a P200 pipette tip to carefully pick up and place the iNPC aggregates on the Transwell membrane.
59. Use a new uncut P200 pipette tip to carefully pipette out the surrounding medium that lingered from the transfer so that the aggregates can attach to the membrane.
units.rationale: Describes formation of iNPC aggregates and their placement onto Transwell membranes for organoid culture.

units.title: Switch from Phase I to Phase II medium
units.text: 60. Place the Transwell plate in the incubator for 1 h. After 1 h, remove the phase I medium and directly add 1 ml of phase II medium (Table 7) into the bottom chamber of the Transwell plate.
units.rationale: Ensures removal of residual CHIR99021 before introducing Phase II conditions.

units.title: Switch from Phase II to Phase III medium
units.text: 62. Day 5. Remove the phase II medium and add 1 ml of phase III medium (Table 7) into the bottom chamber of the Transwell plate.
units.rationale: Progresses organoid development to the maturation stage.

units.title: Harvesting iNPC‑derived nephron organoids
units.text: 64. Day 21. Harvest the iNPC‑derived nephron organoids for various assays to characterize the organoids (Step 65).
units.rationale: Final step to collect organoids for downstream analysis.
